{"step_by_step_thinking": "Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) is a condition that can be influenced by diet. LDL cholesterol is a type of fat that can build up in the arteries and cause CAD, so keeping levels below 100 mg/dl is a good goal. Saturated fats can also contribute to CAD, so keeping them to less than 7% of total calories is another good goal. However, while moderate alcohol consumption can have some heart benefits, 30 ml/day is above the recommended limit for both men and women, and excessive alcohol consumption can actually increase the risk of CAD. Therefore, not all of the options are correct.", "answer_choice": "B. Saturated fat <7% of total calories."}
